trans-unit.source: Represents a control that allows the user to select a single item from a list that is displayed when the user clicks a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton"></xref>.

Although <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> replace and add functionality to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu"></xref> control of previous versions, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu"></xref> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> to display drop-down lists of options, such as a color picker.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` to enable item reordering; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Opacity"></xref> of the form can be adjusted.
This property is meaningful only when UI effects are enabled on the host operating system.
Changing the property value when UI effects are disabled has no effect.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Opacity"></xref> of the form can be adjusted; otherwise, `false`.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AnchorStyles"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control should automatically close when it has lost activation.
If you want a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> that always stays open, set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.AutoClose%2A> to `false`.
Consider handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Closing> event instead of setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.AutoClose%2A> property.
Inspect the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownClosingEventArgs.CloseReason%2A> field in your <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Closing> handler to specify custom closing logic.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control automatically closes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> automatically adjusts its size when the form is resized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control automatically resizes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.BindingContext"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> can be sent to an overflow menu.
`true` to send <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> items to an overflow menu; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the focus or keyboard user interface (UI) cues change.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Closes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control for the specified reason.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Close%2A> method to close a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> control under specific conditions, such as when an application is started or an item is selected by clicking the control, if the focus changes, or if specified keyboard action occurs.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownCloseReason"></xref> values.
Closes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is closed.
When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event.
To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event.
The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.
For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control is about to close.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The shortcut menu associated with the control.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The shortcut menu associated with the control.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This event is not relevant to this class.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the control.
Creates a handle for the control.
Applies various layout options to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> values.

The possibilities are <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle.Flow"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle.HorizontalStackWithOverflow"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle.StackWithOverflow"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle.Table"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle.VerticalStackWithOverflow"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutSettings"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
Gets parameters of a new window.

You can override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.CreateParams%2A> property to add extra functionality to inheriting classes, but you must first call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams> method of the base class to verify that the control continues to work correctly.
An object of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> used when creating a new window.
Gets the docking location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>, indicating which borders are docked to the container.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default is Top.
Gets or sets the direction in which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is displayed relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
Gets the internal spacing, in pixels, of the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
A value of (0, 0, 1, 0).
Gets a value indicating whether ToolTips are shown for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> by default.
`true` in all cases.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This event is not relevant to this class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a three-dimensional shadow effect appears when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is displayed.
`true` to enable the shadow effect; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the focus enters the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the font of the text displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
If the font is not set, this property returns the font of the parent control.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to the text displayed by the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Font"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ForeColor"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
One of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripDisplayStyle"></xref> the values.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> value.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The boundaries of the ToolStrip move handle.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref> values.
Occurs when the user requests help for a control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.ImeModeChanged"></xref> property has changed.
Gets a value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> was automatically generated.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is generated automatically; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when a key is pressed and held down while the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> has focus.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when a key is pressed while the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> has focus.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when a key is released while the control has focus.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the input focus leaves the control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The coordinates of the upper-left corner of the control relative to the upper-left corner of its container.
Gets the maximum height and width, in pixels, of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> representing the height and width of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>, in pixels.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Closed"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnClosed%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownClosedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Closing"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnClosing%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownClosingEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleCreated"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnHandleCreated%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ItemClicked"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnItemClicked%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnLayout%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.MouseUp"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnMouseUp%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Opened"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnOpened%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Opening"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnOpening%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ParentChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnParentChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.VisibleChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.OnVisibleChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Determines the opacity of the form.
This can only be set on top-level controls.
The level of opacity for the form.
The default is 1.00.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is opened.
When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event.
To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event.
The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.
For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control is opening.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The ToolStripItem that is the overflow button for a ToolStrip with overflow enabled.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> that is the owner of this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> that is the owner of this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
The default value is `null`.
Processes a dialog box character.
The character to process.
`true` if the character was processed by the control; otherwise, `false`.
Processes a dialog box key.
This method is called during message preprocessing to handle dialog box keys, such as TAB, RETURN, ESCAPE, and arrow keys.
This method is called only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsInputKey%2A> method indicates that the control is not processing the key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.ProcessDialogKey%2A> simply sends the character to the parent's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessDialogKey%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, or returns `false` if the control has no parent.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> class overrides this method to perform actual processing of dialog box keys.
This method is only called when the control is hosted in a Windows Forms application or as an ActiveX control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
`true` if the key was processed by the control; otherwise, `false`.
Processes a mnemonic character.
This method is called to give a control the opportunity to process a mnemonic character.
The method should determine whether the control is in a state to process mnemonics and if whether the given character represents a mnemonic.
If so, the method should perform the action associated with the mnemonic and return `true`.
If not, the method should return `false`.
Implementations of this method often use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsMnemonic%2A> method to determine whether the given character matches a mnemonic in the control's text.
For example:
This default implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessMnemonic%2A> method simply returns `false` to indicate that the control has no mnemonic.
The character to process.
`true` if the character was processed as a mnemonic by the control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the window region associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref>.
The window <xref href="System.Drawing.Region"></xref> associated with the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.Region"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft.Inherit"></xref>.
Scales a control's location, size, padding and margin.
The factor by which the height and width of the control will be scaled.
A value that specifies the bounds of the control to use when defining its size and position.
This method is not relevant to this class.
This method is not relevant to this class.
The horizontal scaling factor.
The vertical scaling factor.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Performs the work of setting the specified bounds of this control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Left"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Top"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height"></xref> property value of the control.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified"></xref> values.

Adjusts the size of the owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to accommodate the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> if the owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is currently displayed, or clears and resets active <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> child controls of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is not currently displayed.
`true` if the owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> is currently displayed; otherwise, `false`.
Displays the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> control in its default position.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified screen location.
The horizontal and vertical location of the screen's upper-left corner, in pixels.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified control location and with the specified direction relative to the parent control.
The horizontal and vertical location of the reference control's upper-left corner, in pixels.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified screen coordinates.
The horizontal screen coordinate, in pixels.
The vertical screen coordinate, in pixels.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified control location.
The control (typically, a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton"></xref>) that is the reference point for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> position.
The horizontal and vertical location of the reference control's upper-left corner, in pixels.
The control specified by the control parameter is `null`.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified control at the specified location and with the specified direction relative to the parent control.
The control (typically, a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton"></xref>) that is the reference point for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> position.
The horizontal and vertical location of the reference control's upper-left corner, in pixels.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
The control specified by the control parameter is `null`.
Positions the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> relative to the specified control's horizontal and vertical screen coordinates.
The control (typically, a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton"></xref>) that is the reference point for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> position.
The horizontal screen coordinate of the control, in pixels.
The vertical screen coordinate of the control, in pixels.
The control specified by the control parameter is `null`.
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
`true` to enable stretching; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> style changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
This property is not relevant to this class.
This property is not relevant to this class.
The tab order of the control within its container.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This event is not relevant to this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Specifies the direction in which to draw the text on the item.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextDirection"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextDirection.Horizontal"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is a top-level control.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is a top-level control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form should be displayed as a topmost form.
For more information and a code example, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.TopMost%2A>.
`true` in all cases.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.

This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is visible or hidden.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Processes Windows messages.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
